page.title: 10VALE OF CLWYD FARMING CHANGE
page.content: Pattern of farm work.There is a trend towards a less labour_intensive but more animal intensive type of farming. One dairy farm which kept 50 cows,50 yrs ago,employed 4 men & a boy.They now have 110 cows & 2 men.{Contracting {for silage_making,corn,hedging, {ploughing and ditching is usual}.Only the large estates tend to employ workers{.Silage}is now widely used as fodder.It is a more reliable crop than {hay}.It is stored in a variety of ways,in a silage clamp,in a heap outdoors{under polythene,or as haylage which is wilted,unchopped grass,in a circular shape & enclosed in an airtight polythene bag.Sheep:Because of high market value of sheep,there is a growing trend to lambing indoors to reduce losses.
